Our mission is to enable partners to build deep expertise and thriving business practices with Pivotal.
Making Transformation Real
In October, our editorial focus was on Making Transformation Real. We’ve talked the talk for digital transformation. Now it’s time to walk the walk and make it real.
Welcome back to the Pivotal Global Ecosystem newsletter! Below are 3 great perspectives and lessons learned from successful digital transformation:
Videos
- Learn how Citi transformed its mobile wallet <[[https://content.pivotal.io/springone-platform-2018/citi-s-road-to-transformation-an-executive-perspective]]> to bounded-context microservices on PCF with the help of Solstice.
- Find out why T-Mobile adopted PKS <[[https://content.pivotal.io/videos/making-multi-cloud-a-reality-at-t-mobile-brendan-aye-james-webb]]> and how it thinks about which apps and workloads to run on it. - Rabobank initially built its own platform, but soon turned to PCF. Get the full story <[[https://content.pivotal.io/videos/rabobank-vincent-oostindie-business-architect]]>, plus hear about its unique PoC process.
Check out the Making Transformation Real content stream <[[https://content.pivotal.io/making-transformation-real]]> for full coverage of the topic and don’t forget! You can embed the content stream of your choice in your own site. Find the embed code here <[[https://partners.pivotal.io/English/Global/sales/partner-information.aspx#contentstream]]>.
Upcoming Webinar - PKS and the Partner Ecosystem
Please join us for the November Pivotal Global Ecosystem webinar on PKS and the Partner Ecosystem. Pivotal’s Chad Sakac and Melissa Larson will talk about the opportunity PKS presents for Pivotal and our partners, the developing go-to-market strategy, account targeting, and what to look forward to in preparation for GA launch.
Register here <[[https://partners.pivotal.io/English/webinars-events.aspx]]> Date: November 14, 2018 Time: 2PM ET

Marketing

Learn how to sponsor a city <[[https://springonetour.io/2018/sponsor]]> that is critical to your practice. - April 2-4, 2019: Cloud Foundry Summit North America <[[https://www.cloudfoundry.org/event/nasummit2019/]]> is coming to Philadelphia. - Oct 7-10, 2019: Start planning now for SpringOne Platform 2019 in Austin, TX! Please contact us at sponsorS1P@pivotal.io <[[mailto:sponsorS1P@pivotal.io]]> about 2019 sponsorship.
BEST PRACTICE OF THE MONTH: Submitting talks for CF Summit North America
The call for proposals closes on November 30th <[[https://www.cloudfoundry.org/event_subpages/cfna-2019-cfp/]]>! This is a great way to showcase your expertise to the Cloud Foundry community. Here are helpful tips for submitting:
- Share the stage with a customer! Having an end user as part of your talk will increase the likelihood of it’s acceptance. - Pay close attention to the categories. Make sure your talk clearly fits with the category you are submitting to. You may have to tweak your story a bit to make it fit! - Craft a strong headline! A track name that stands out helps not only to get your talk accepted, but then also to get people in the room! Put some numbers in there, make it memorable!
Partner Spotlight: Rackspace
Managed Services Provider // Pivotal Cloud Foundry
Rackspace enables you to leverage the Pivotal Cloud Foundry® platform to deliver next-generation apps, by providing the resources needed to manage it on any infrastructure you choose. With Rackspace Managed Pivotal Cloud Foundry you can accelerate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications in multi-cloud environments.
Getting the Joint Story Out
Rackspace focuses on the value proposition of their Managed PCF offering, including the value of PCF itself. Here are some highlights:
- Revisiting the Forrester Total Economic Impact study for PCF in “How Companies are Saving Millions with Pivotal Cloud Foundry <[[https://blog.rackspace.com/companies-saving-millions-pivotal-cloud-foundry]]>” - Explaining how Rackspace proactively manages PCF operations in “Why Do I Need Rackspace If I Can Just Run 'cf push'? <[[https://blog.rackspace.com/why-need-rackspace-pivotal-cloud-foundry]]>”
Find more content from Rackspace about working with Pivotal here <[[https://content.pivotal.io/rackspace]]>.
“Rackspace’s partnership with Pivotal to provide a multi-cloud managed service for Pivotal Cloud Foundry allows our customers to reduce their operational costs and focus on delivering new innovation faster.”
- Scott Crenshaw, Executive Vice President, Rackspace
